resources.string: GTFS Read and Show - VTA - v0.1.6 (alpha)

This android application has been built in response to a programming competition sponsored by the Valley Transit Authority of Santa Clara, California (VTA). http://www.vta.org/appcontest (July 2011) The competition goal is to build a mobile application using the Google Transit Feed Specification data, published by VTA at http://www.vta.org/dev/data/google_transit.zip To meet the deadline (Sept 12th) I have published the application before it is complete. Still TODO: (1) Properly display the schedules through show schedule. (2) Utilize Enter Destination to maintain a list of frequent destinations. (3) Employ a route planning algorithm to determine multiple and the fastest mode to arrive at the destination from the current location. (4) Allow for user feedback on a separate activity - though I am not sure if the Android Market Place is a better solution.
November 2011 by JJ Stiff, Santa Clara, CA.
The GTFS data file is supplied by VTA. Remove the data file so that during the next loading process a new copy of the data file will be downloaded.
The data file is loaded into memory and occupies almost 10MB of RAM. Clear the memory and this application is mostly useless until you reload the data.
Without this button you could reload the memory by force quitting and then re-running the application. First remove the data file, then reload the memory to get the latest data loaded.
